intro: Epilobium confusum, commonly known as the confused willow or yellow willow, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces showy, yellow-orange flowers in clusters. Its botanical features include a woody stem that becomes more pronounced with age, and it is part of the Onagraceae family. Epilobium confusum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
